topic.title: describe
topic.shortdesc: Display details of a member's configuration, shell connection, disk-stores, members, or regions.

topic.title: describe client
topic.shortdesc: Displays details about a specified client.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Required. ID of the client. To find a client ID, you can use the list clients command to display a list of connected clients and their IDs.

body.codeblock: gfsh>describe client --clientID=172.16.196.144(4987:loner):58922:7b3398cf ------------------------------------------------------------------- Primary Servers : 172.16.196.144(server1:5764)<v1>:15189 Secondary Servers : 172.16.196.144(server2:5891)<v2>:39082 CPU : 0 Number of Cache Listner Calls : 0 Number of Gets : 0 Number of Misses : 0 Number of Puts : 0 Number of Threads : 0 Process CPU Time (nanoseconds) : 0 Queue size : 1 UP Time (seconds) : 67 Is Durable : No

topic.title: describe config
topic.shortdesc: Display the configuration of a member.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Name or ID of a member whose configuration is to be shown.
Whether to hide configuration information for properties with the default value.

body.codeblock:
gfsh>describe config --member=server1 Configuration of member : "server1"
JVM command line arguments ----------------------------------- -Dgemfire.mcast-port=0 -Dgemfire.locators=localhost[10334]
GemFire properties defined using the API ................................................ log-file : vf.gf.server.log name : server1
GemFire properties defined at the runtime ................................................ log-level : finest statistic-sampling-enabled : true
Cache attributes ................................................ is-server : true
Cache-server attributes . bind-address : localhost

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

topic.title: describe disk-store
topic.shortdesc: Display information about a member's disk store.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Required. Name/ID of the member with the disk store to be described.
Required. Name of the disk store to be described.

body.codeblock:
gfsh>describe disk-store --name=disk1 --member=server1 Disk Store ID : a531bc7b-5188-4510-85d7-de7de30c6671 Disk Store Name : disk1 Member ID : ubuntu(server1:7467)<v1>:35249 Member Name : server1 Allow Force Compaction : No Auto Compaction : Yes Compaction Threshold : 50 Max Oplog Size : 1024 Queue Size : 0 Time Interval : 1000 Write Buffer Size : 32768 Disk Usage Warning Percentage : 90 Disk Usage Critical Percentage : 99 PDX Serialization Meta-Data Stored : No
Disk Directory | Size ------------------------------- | ---------- /home/stymon/server1/DiskStore1 | 2147483647

topic.title: describe member
topic.shortdesc: Display details of a member with given name/id.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Required. Display information about a member, including name, ID, groups, regions, etc.

body.codeblock:
gfsh>describe member --name=server1 Name : server1 Id : GemFireStymon(server1:240)<v1>:64871 Host : 192.168.129.129 Regions : region4 region5 region3 region2 region1
PID : 240 Groups : Used Heap : 5M Max Heap : 123M Working Dir : c:\PivotalGemFire70\Latest\server1 Log file : C:\PivotalGemFire70\Latest\server1\vf.gf.server.log Locators : localhost[10334]
Server Bind : localhost Server Port : 40404 Running : true Client Connections : 0

topic.title: describe offline-disk-store
topic.shortdesc: Display information about an offline member's disk store.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Required. Name of the disk store to be described.
Required. Directory that contains the disk store files.
If set (or set to true), display all the pdx types stored in the disk store.
Name and path of the region in the disk store to be described.

topic.title: describe region
topic.shortdesc: Display the attributes and key information of a region.

body.p: Availability: Online. You must be connected in gfsh to a JMX Manager member to use this command.

row.entry: Required. Name/Path of the region to be described.

body.codeblock:
gfsh>describe region --name=region1 .......................................................... Name : region1 Data Policy : normal Hosting Members : server1 server2
Non-Default Attributes Shared By Hosting Members
Type | Name | Value ------ | ----------- | ------ Region | data-policy | NORMAL | size | 0
